title: David Bowie's Surprise Gift for a Village Car Park
summary: David Bowie was a famous singer who died in 2016. A man named Norman Miller from Binley Woods village in Warwickshire wanted Bowie to play a concert at their village hall to raise money for a car park. He wrote letters to Bowie, but Bowie's son Duncan Jones said no because Bowie was sick. After Bowie died, Jones sent Miller a letter with a joke and a surprise: he gave £10,116 to help pay for the car park. Miller was surprised and thought it might be a trick, but the money was real. Now, the village calls it 'the car park David Bowie paid for.' This story shows how Bowie's family was kind and remembered the letters.

background_read: David Bowie was a very popular singer known for his music and style. He died in 2016. This story is about a kind act from his family after his death. It shows how people can help others in surprising ways, even when they are famous. The village of Binley Woods needed money for a car park, and Bowie's son helped make it happen because of letters sent to Bowie.
